title: Activating Open Collective
body:
Hi, I'm making updates for Open Collective. Either you or a supporter signed this repo up for Open Collective. This pull request adds backers and sponsors from your Open Collective https://opencollective.com/mastalab ‚ù§Ô∏è
  
  It adds two badges at the top to show the latest number of backers and sponsors. It also adds placeholders so that the avatar/logo of new backers/sponsors can automatically be shown without having to update your README.md. [[more info](https://github.com/opencollective/opencollective/wiki/Github-banner)]. See how it looks on [this repo](https://github.com/apex/apex#backers).
You can also add a "Donate" button to your website and automatically show your backers and sponsors there with our widgets. Have a look here: https://opencollective.com/widgets

  P.S: As with any pull request, feel free to comment or suggest changes. The only thing "required" are the placeholders on the README because we believe it's important to acknowledge the people in your community that are contributing (financially or with code!).

  Thank you for your great contribution to the open source community. You are awesome! üôå
  And welcome to the open collective community! üòä

  Come chat with us in the #opensource channel on https://slack.opencollective.com - great place to ask questions and share best practices with other open source sustainers!

title: Add screenshots for F-Droid store
body:
This PR aims at adding screenshots to the listing in the F-Droid store.
Descriptions/ images can either be added to this repo or to https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/tree/master/metadata

The files get updated to the F-Droid store on a release, not by merging this PR.

- [ ] A feature image can be added by adding the file `./fastlane/metadata/android/en-US/images/featureGraphic.png`.

How to add screens to F-Droid: https://f-droid.org/en/docs/All_About_Descriptions_Graphics_and_Screenshots/

Fastlane's doc: https://docs.fastlane.tools/actions/supply/#images-and-screenshots

title: Second go...
body: Put a UNIQUE constraint on the two columns instance, and status_id, so that in combination they have to be unique.

title: Changed the structure of STATUSES_CACHE table
body:
Added a UNIQUE ON CONFLICT IGNORE constraint to STATUS_ID column in STATUSES_CACHE table structure, so that duplicate statuses are quietly ignored and not inserted.

I know you have code in place to upgrade the tables, when / if their structure is changed, but I've only changed the CREATE_TABLE_STATUSES_CACHE string.

I've tested it on my tablet with this altered table structure, the only issue is that it reports x statuses being imported, when they won't necessarily be, if they already exist in the table.

IGNORE seemed the best option, cf. [ON CONFLICT clause](https://sqlite.org/lang_conflict.html)

title: [WIP] add adaptive icon
body:
It just bugs me so much that mastalab has no adaptive icon. This is not yet perfect, I would need a svg with the shadow included. Would be awesome if you can provide one. Or I could use pngs instead of vector drawable, but vector drawable is just so much better. 

![screenshot_20180217-110902](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10157047/36340114-d4886e52-13d5-11e8-9d9b-bebae651d4aa.png)

Also I removed unused ic_launcher_round that was bundled into the apk, but never shown.

title: Added code to do a timed reveal for NSFW images in notification tab.
body: Only just realised that this was missing, since attachments are now loaded into mentions and favourites.

title: Added code to fix a crash.
body:
Fixes a crash when a user doesn't wait for ConversationActivity to complete loading statuses, presses back and then taps on the status again, which can sometimes lead to the Glide library being passed a destroyed context, which causes it to complain and crash.

This was the issue I raised the other day, #140.

I'm still trying to create the crash with this code in place, since I can't guarentee it's fixed the issue 100%.

Catch22 (;*

title: TumblrFix: Added code to change an image URL to 'https://' rather than 'http://'‚Ä¶
body:
‚Ä¶ so that sharing from Tumblr works.

Note: Currently if you mention someone, and image URL has been fixed the end (last character)of the URL in toot gets removed in TootActivity.

title: Added a fix for a url that arrives sans 'http://'.
body: See toot: https://mastodon.xyz/@PhotonQyv/99087475125987362 (Used BBC iPlayer app as example), versus: https://mastodon.xyz/@PhotonQyv/99087639007346080 after the additional fix of adding 'http://' into actual toot text.

title: Fix malformed url exception sharing intent
body: This fixes the situation where what comes in notionally as a URL is just some text. Code now checks for a valid URL before trying to get it via JSoup library. Fixes what I mentioned in comment for #66

title: Added a fix for Wikipedia (& other apps perhaps)...
body:
Adds extra checks to make sure title & description have content before replacing the original sharedContent with either of them.

I noticed that when sharing from Wikipedia these values are both empty non-null Strings (""), which were then pasted into the toot rather than the original sharedContent contents. So you just ended up with the URL with no context in your shared-from-Wikipedia toot. It might fix other app sharing too, but I've only noticed this with Wikipedia.

title: Release 1.5.5
body: - New features: - Possibility to pick up accounts involved in a conversation for a reply - Adds content description for media (simple click once uploaded, the long click is now used to delete the media) - Progress bar (with the percentage) when uploading - Layout improvements: - Removes CardViews - Removes splash screen - Hides the tool bar when scrolling - Improvements with the profile page - Use of vector icons - Number of replies next to reply icon
